title: Competition between Assassins
body: I wonder what would happen if Shaco, Eve, Akali, Katarina and Jhin realized they were hunting the same target? Would it end up in a Mexican stand-off?

replies.body: It would be a pretty wild and unlikely situation to have all them in the same place,  but not impossible i suppose.   AlThough I think it would be really interesting to see what happens if one of those assassins were ordered to work with Jhin instead.

Do you think Jhin's "performance" would take priority over the optimal completion of his mission? If his employer prefer him not to kill an assassin sent to work with him, would he do it anyway if he felt like it? Or would he prefer a perfect mission completion?

Do you think he's capable of working in a team, or at the very least, co operate? He seems to *prefer* working alone, although that doesn't always mean that someone is *incapable* of co-operating with one or more other people.
He works alone.  That said, what think is interesting is he could work with someone if forced.   But working with an ocd psycopath would be... Interesting.
I wonder if he'd be more busy trying to make sure his partner is doing perfectly, or trying to make sure *he* is doing perfectly.

"NO NO NO! Look at this mess! You couldn't wait one more second before stabbing them in the back?!"

{{champion:35}} "They tripped over their own feet trying to escape and fell on my knife, that's the joke!"

"We were meant to assassinate them in _4/4_ time; their final scream was off beat YOU UNCULTURED IMBECILE!"

{{champion:35}} ". . . I don't think you appreciate irony."

I'm not gonna lie, in my head canon Jhin has mad respect for Shaco's professional work as a comedian and thinks he is absolutely hilarious, albiet maybe lowbrow. I like to imagine him speaking of the orgins of clown in performance art.

I imagine Jhin is among the few who can truly appreciate shaco's work.

Also a good shaco player IS an artist. A hateful artist.

Jhin: Alright, we're going to do this in order of the second Ionian Banquet murder-

{{champion:55}} *jumps in and kills everything*

Jhin: ... *Turns to Talon*
...is she always like this?

{{champion:91}}: You have no idea.
i had to go get my brother to show him this.  I have a quote for when i main him now.  Ty

> [{quoted}](name=LungDrakkar,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=qJOjjQlz,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-01-16T19:02:58.157+0000)
>
>in a Mexican stand-off?

Das waycis...  I'm from Mexico and let me tell you, I am deeply offended.

(/Just kidding, I'm from Mexico but I don't care)

> would be a pretty wild and unlikely situation to have all them in the same place

RIP the core premise of original League Lore....

I think with the up and coming target audience, tumblr fanfiction > lore.

In all seriousness, if Jhin's lore reads like fifty shades, I will be very displeased.

I think the biggest difference between shaco and jhin is that one loves comedy and one loves tragedy.

But I have this big feeling shaco support/jung with jhin adc/mid will be really fun in a roll play factor.
Like for example shaco counterjungs and jhin is casually ulting to back him up to see him wreak havoc.
even having a bot duo with dual invisible traps seems fun.
Honestly, even just a standoff between Shaco and Jhin would be crazy enough
I think Shaco'd win, just by the fact of being an extradimensional horror in evil clown form.
Eve would win... because she is a better hunter than them. The rest of them are assasins, not Hunters.. that is the kew word.
